descript.abstract: Protected Area boundaries for sites administered by Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta. National Parks, because of their similar intent, are also included.
descript.purpose: Provided for use by GoA staff, and the general public. Boundaries have been interpreted from written legal descriptions appended to Orders-in-Council. In case of discrepancy between the GIS data and the written legal description, the written legal description shall take precedence.

idinfo.accconst: Data are subject to frequent change, without notice. The user assumes all responsibility for ensuring their data are current. Current data can be obtained directly from Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta.

secinfo.secsys: Government of Alberta Information Security Classification http://imtdocs.alberta.ca/standards/information-security-classification-.aspx

horizpa.horizpar: In general +/- 5m where a protected area boundary follows ATS or hydrography. Accuracy can decrease to +/- 20m where protected area boundaries follow features which have been updated from IRS imagery.

procstep.procdesc: Order-in Council legal descriptions are interpreted. For most sites, a boundary based on the legal was created in MicroStation using 1:20K mapping files from Informatics Branch, Alberta Environment and Parks. The MicroStation derived boundary was then brought into ARC/INFO and incorporated in the Protected Areas data set. For newer sites, boundaries have been created solely in ARC/INFO or ArcGIS, using Base Features data from Informatics Branch. Data are now maintained exclusively in an SDE Geodatabase.

citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Government of Alberta Base Features Alberta Township Survey (ATS) datasets

pubinfo.publish: Informatics Branch, Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

citeinfo.othercit: Legal subdivision, quarter section, section, and township datasets are all used to properly position or align Park/Protected Area boundaries. Boundaries may be traced directly from ATS lines, or may be used to align a Park/Protected Area boundary a given distance from an ATS boundary.

citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Government of Alberta Base Features Hydrography datasets

pubinfo.publish: Informatics Branch, Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

citeinfo.othercit: Hydrography polygons and the single line stream network are used to properly position or align Park/Protected Area boundaries. Boundaries may be traced directly from hydrography lines, or may be used to align a Park/Protected Area boundary a given distance from a hydrography feature.

citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Government of Alberta Base Features Roads dataset

pubinfo.publish: Informatics Branch, Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

citeinfo.othercit: Roads are used to properly position or align Park/Protected Area boundaries. Boundaries may be traced directly from road lines, or may be used to align a Park/Protected Area boundary a given distance from a road.

citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Government of Alberta Base Features Cadastral datasets

pubinfo.publish: Informatics Branch, Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

citeinfo.othercit: Rights of way, block boundaries, lot boundaries, and ownership polygons are all used to properly position or align Park/Protected Area boundaries. Boundaries may be traced directly from cadastral lines, or may be used to align a Park/Protected Area boundary a given distance from a cadastral boundary.

citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Government of Alberta Base Features Contour Lines dataset

pubinfo.publish: Informatics Branch, Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

citeinfo.othercit: Contour lines are used to properly position or align Park/Protected Area boundaries. Contour lines assist in determining heights of land or breaks in slope that may form a boundary in an area with significant elevation relief.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Alberta Parks, Government of Alberta - Base Features (ATS v4.1)

attr.attrdef: Classification or Type of Protected Area - Code

edom.edomvd: Ecological Reserves preserve and protect natural heritage in an undisturbed state for scientific research and education.
edom.edomvds: Ecological Reserve (Wilderness Areas, Ecological Reserves, Natural Areas and Heritage Rangelands Act)

edom.edomvd: Natural Areas preserve and protect sites of local significance and provide opportunities for low-impact recreation and nature appreciation activities.
edom.edomvds: Natural Area (Wilderness Areas, Ecological Reserves, Natural Areas and Heritage Rangelands Act)

edom.edomvd: National Parks are "representative natural areas of Canadian significance", protected for public understanding, appreciation and enjoyment, while being maintained in an unimpaired state for future generations.
edom.edomvds: National Parks Act

edom.edomvd: Provincial Parks preserve natural heritage; they support outdoor recreation, heritage tourism and natural heritage appreciation activities that depend upon and are compatible with environmental protection
edom.edomvds: Provincial Park (Provincial Parks Act)

edom.edomvd: Provincial Recreation Areas support outdoor recreation and tourism; they often provide access to lakes, rivers, reservoirs and adjacent Crown land.
edom.edomvds: Provincial Recreation Area (Provincial Parks Act)

edom.edomvd: Wilderness Areas preserve and protect natural heritage, where visitors are provided with opportunities for non-consumptive, nature-based, outdoor recreation.
edom.edomvds: Wilderness Area (Wilderness Areas, Ecological Reserves, Natural Areas and Heritage Rangelands Act)

edom.edomvd: Willmore Wilderness Park was established under its own legislation in April 1959; it is similar in intent to Wildland Parks.
edom.edomvds: Willmore Wilderness Park (Willmore Wilderness Park Act)

edom.edomvd: Wildland Provincial Parks preserve and protect natural heritage and provide opportunities for backcountry recreation.
edom.edomvds: Wildland Provincial Park (Provincial Parks Act)

edom.edomvd: Heritage Rangelands preserve and protect natural features that are representative of Alberta's prairies; grazing is used to maintain the grassland ecology.
edom.edomvds: Heritage Rangeland (Wilderness Areas, Ecological Reserves, Natural Areas and Heritage Rangelands Act)

edom.edomvd: Established (or reserved) for the purpose of conservation
edom.edomvds: Alberta Parks, Government of Alberta

edom.edomvd: Established (or reserved) for the purpose of education
edom.edomvds: Alberta Parks, Government of Alberta

edom.edomvd: Established (or reserved) for the purpose of recreation
edom.edomvds: Alberta Parks, Government of Alberta

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Positive real numbers that are calculated using 10-degree Transverse Mercator Projection, NAD 83 datum.

edom.edomvd: Strict Nature Reserve: protected area managed mainly for science
edom.edomvds: Area of land and/or sea possessing some outstanding or representative ecosystems, geological or physiological features and/or species, available primarily for scientific research and/or environmental monitoring.

edom.edomvd: Wilderness Area: protected area managed mainly for wilderness protection
edom.edomvds: Large area of unmodified or slightly modified land, and/or sea, retaining its natural character and influence, without permanent or significant habitation, which is protected and managed so as to preserve its natural condition.

edom.edomvd: National Park: protected area managed mainly for ecosystem protection and recreation
edom.edomvds: Natural area of land and/or sea, designated to (a) protect the ecological integrity of one or more ecosystems for present and future generations, (b) exclude exploitation or occupation inimical to the purposes of designation of the area and (c) provide a foundation for spiritual, scientific, educational, recreational and visitor opportunities, all of which must be environmentally and culturally compatible.

edom.edomvd: Natural Monument: protected area managed mainly for conservation of specific natural features
edom.edomvds: Area containing one, or more, specific natural or natural/cultural feature which is of outstanding or unique value because of its inherent rarity, representative or aesthetic qualities or cultural significance.

edom.edomvd: Habitat/Species Management Area: protected area managed mainly for conservation through management intervention
edom.edomvds: Area of land and/or sea subject to active intervention for management purposes so as to ensure the maintenance of habitats and/or to meet the requirements of specific species.

edom.edomvd: Protected Landscape/Seascape: protected area managed mainly for landscape/seascape conservation and recreation
edom.edomvds: Area of land, with coast and sea as appropriate, where the interaction of people and nature over time has produced an area of distinct character with significant aesthetic, ecological and/or cultural value, and often with high biological diversity. Safeguarding the integrity of this traditional interaction is vital to the protection, maintenance and evolution of such an area.

edom.edomvd: Managed Resource Protected Area: protected area managed mainly for the sustainable use of natural ecosystems
edom.edomvds: Area containing predominantly unmodified natural systems, managed to ensure long term protection and maintenance of biological diversity, while providing at the same time a sustainable flow of natural products and services to meet community needs.

edom.edomvd: Not Reported
edom.edomvds: Site is not reported as these sites do not meet the IUCN definition of a protected area.

edom.edomvd: Not Reported - Subsurface
edom.edomvds: Site is not reported due to existing subsurface mineral commitments with surface access, although site otherwise meets IUCN definition of a protected area (protected area category as per NOTES field, in these cases).

attr.attrdef: Order-in-Council number - An Order-in-council is a legislative order in relation to and authorized by an existing act of the legislature.
Notes to clarify history &/or context of protected area.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are calculated using 10-degree Transverse Mercator Projection, NAD 83 datum.

attr.attrdef: The date of the current Order-in-Council, referenced by the OC_NO attribute.
Automatically generated identifier for each record.
Date of establishment of the protected area.
Full site name on the Order-in-Council.

In case of discrepancy between the GIS data and the written legal description, the written legal description shall take precedence.

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr:
GIS shapefile can be downloaded from: https://www.albertaparks.ca/media/2941843/parks_and_protected_areas_alberta.zip
Google Earth KML can be downloaded from: https://www.albertaparks.ca/media/6492787/protected-area-kmz-outline.zip
Questions can be directed to: AEP.Parks.GIS@gov.ab.ca

prcStep.stepDesc: Minor edits to line work: Athabasca Dunes ER, Prairie Coulees NA.
prcStep.stepRat: Topological integrity, best representation of Order-in-Council legal land description.

prcStep.stepDesc: Modification of IUCN category for various sites.
prcStep.stepRat: Part of ongoing protected area site-based review/reporting processes.

prcStep.stepDesc: "Prairie Coulees Natural Area" renamed to "Hargrave Coulees Natural Area"
Modification of IUCN category for various sites.

prcStep.stepDesc: Edited polygon for Wood Buffalo National Park of Canada, to exclude boundaries of Thebathi and ?EJeré K'elni Kue First Nations.
prcStep.stepRat: Best representation of legal description, as found in National Parks Act.
